did.unittitle: Letters
William Henry Hurlbertto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Praises Palmer for the idea of a collection of poems and mentions George Darley. ] w/typed transcript

did.unittitle: Parke Godwinto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Approves proposed collection of Palmer's writings.]

did.unittitle: Charles A[nderson] Danato John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Approves suggested publication of an illustrated edition of "Folk Songs."]

did.unittitle: James T. Fieldsto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Approves his collection of autographic poems; confirms ownership of "Abou ben Adam"; refers to Palmer's admirer, the "Auyocrat [sic] of the Breakfast Table ( Oliver Wendell Holmes)."]

did.unittitle: Horace Greeleyto [ John Williamson Palmer]

scopecontent.p: [Makes an appointment with Palmer to discuss his article on Appleton's Cyclopaedia.]

did.unittitle: Jules Micheletto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks Palmer for the honor done his book by its English translation.], in French, with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Jules Micheletto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks Palmer for his expression of sympathy; refers to his American in-laws; and mentions [Matthew Fontaine] Maury. ] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: F. E. Longfellowto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for the illustrated song book.]

did.unittitle: Matthew Fontaine Mauryto James Croxall Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Refers to biographical notes about himself in Southern Literary Messenger, Allibone's Dictionaryand New America Encyclopedia. ]

did.unittitle: James C. Palmerto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Refers to Matthew Fontaine Maury's pedigree and John Williamson Palmer's article in the Inquireron "Free Speech," and includes his own thoughts on the subject. Palmer also mentions South Carolina's secession.]

did.unittitle: William Henry Hurlbertto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Expresses his pleasure with Palmer's poetry in [ Camp and Canteen Life?].]

did.unittitle: William Henry Hurlbertto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks Palmer for his book, which he looks forward to reading and studying.]

did.unittitle: Francis Seymour Hadento John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Suggests that his contribution to the portfolio correspond in style with "Challow Farm" rather than "Shere Mill Pond" and "Sunset In Ireland," as these go back twenty years in style.]

did.unittitle: Maxime Lalanneto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Discusses her plans and the difficulty with the printing plates of the aqua fortis of Trouville; and provides requested information concerning the plate.] in French, with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: David Lawto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [States that the plate will be ready and in Goulding's hands for printing soon; and mentions [Hubert] Herkomer. ] w/typed transcript

did.unittitle: Frederick Arthur Bridgmanto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Mentions letter from [Charles] Courtry; and regrets he cannot promise Palmer his services.]

did.unittitle: Alphonse Legrosto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Discusses aqua fortis with a beggar theme which he has just completed.] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Alphonse Legrosto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends biographical information and promises to send a catalogue of his own etchings and principal paintings.] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Frederick Arthur Bridgmanto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Discusses the work of Lalanne, Lancon and Martial; and sends regards.]

did.unittitle: Axel Herman Haigto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends biographical information and current works; refers to Ewan Christian, William Burges, and Edd. Barry. ] w/typed transcript

did.unittitle: L. Lanconto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Appreciates Palmer's praise for his plate; and asks him to forward the money for it from Boston. ] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Hubert Herkomerto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends list of plates and mezzotints; and discusses his experience as an artist.] with etching and typed transcript

did.unittitle: Ch[arles] Courtryto "Dear Sir"

scopecontent.p: [States that the plate is finished and has been given to Salmon the printer; explains a mix-up in correspondence; and acknowledges the receipt of John Williamson Palmer's payment.] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Arthur Collinsto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Writing for Princess Louise (Marchioness of Lorne), Collins acknowledges the receipt of the letter and asks Palmer to bring the autograph etchings the following day.]

did.unittitle: Heywood Hardyto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Acknowledges cheque for sixty-three pounds, sent by Henry F. Gilling. ]

did.unittitle: James Tissotto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends the proofs for "Two Friends"; inquires about Palmer's work and the success of Tissot's "The Prodigal Son."] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: R. H. Chatsworthto [ John Williamson Palmer]

scopecontent.p: [Says he will write the introduction to Palmer's book for free.]

did.unittitle: W. H. Carpenterto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Refers to a review of Palmer's book, and The Saturday Review; and discusses the "new school" of novelists including [Henry] James, [William Dean] Howells, and Balzac. ]

did.unittitle: Helena Modjeska to John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Praises his play The Queen's Heartbut regrets that she is unable to produce it; and mentions the enthusiasm of Longfellow, Holmes and Lowell toward the play.]

did.unittitle: Charles G. D. Hobartto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends autographed copy of "Epitaph for a Husbandman"; and mentions Palmer's poem in The Centuryon Theodosia Burr. ]

did.unittitle: Avander Staalto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Writing for the Queen of the Netherlands, Staal thanks Palmer for "Orange Boven."] w/a card and typed transcript

did.unittitle: James T. Fieldsto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends a list of his collection of poems written in the handwriting of twenty-two authors.]

did.unittitle: Charles H. Webbto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Makes some critical comments on "the book," an unidentified novel by Palmer.]

did.unittitle: Lady John Campbellto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks Palmer for the collection of poems "For Charlie's Sake."]

did.unittitle: L. Daniellito John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Thanks Palmer for an article; and sends two figurines as a gift.] in French, with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Charles H. Webbto John Williamson Palmer
George Grey Barnardto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Offers to show Palmer his statue of "Man."]

did.unittitle: Francis Seymour Haydento John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Discusses his pending lecture tour; and refers to [Hubert] Herkomerand [James R.?] Osgood. ]

did.unittitle: Robert W. MacBethto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends etching "The Ferry Inn" with comment on its theme.] w/typed transcript

did.unittitle: M. Martialto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Sends the proofs of aqua fortis In the Forest. ] in French with a typed English transcript

did.unittitle: Mrs. Suydaur to John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Gives an elaborate account of an elm tree planted in his honor.]

did.unittitle: Jules Micheletto John Williamson Palmer

scopecontent.p: [Letter written in French, no transcript available.]
